Posts.Content: Aug 23, 2013 09:12AM heathcliff4 wrote: I hear you.  I posted just below you (the losing my mind post). :)  I'm your age with zero family history but much likely chance of malignancy.  My surgery was last Friday.  I'm so sorry you are going through this too.  Wishing you the best of luck.   To add insult to injury, my mouth is broken out in canker sores (I know, tmi) from stress.
Posts.Title: Waiting for core needle biopsy results - ugh! np123 np123

Posts.Content: heathcliff4 wrote: I haven't posted yet, but I have read many posts during my research in the last few weeks since my abnormal mammogram.  I had two biopsies last Friday (one for a 1 cm lump w. BiRads 5 rating, the other for calcifications 4b) and I was so sure I'd hear early that I basically ignored my surgeon's warning that it would take 3-5 days.  I've been on pins and needles and I'm sick to my stomach w. anxiety.  Just needed to let it out somewhere.   I've called the surgeon's office yesterday and today and I KNOW they will call me, but I keep hoping that at least they will say, "Yes, the results are in and she will call you this afternoon."  But, they don't.   I have my follow up appointment on Monday and I'm just praying I don't have to wait through the weekend.  Fwiw, my 6 year old just started a new school today and my 2.5 year old will start preschool in another week. Thanks for "listening."  43yo w. no family history of bc and quite shocked Dx 8/23/2013, IDC, 1cm, Stage IIA, Grade 3, 2/5 nodes, ER+/PR-, HER2+ Surgery 9/8/2013 Mastectomy: Right; Prophylactic mastectomy: Left; Reconstruction (left): Tissue expander placement; Reconstruction (right): Tissue expander placement Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Day 4 of waiting for Biopsy Results on Birads 5 mass heathcliff4 heathcliff4

Posts.Content: Aug 22, 2013 02:27PM heathcliff4 wrote: Thank you, SpecialK.  That did cross my mind, so I wasn't surprised I didn't hear from her on her surgery day.  She explicitly said, "You will get a call from me."  That said, if she has nothing to tell me, she has nothing.  I also know they have appointments, etc and must need to schedule a chunk of time for these calls.   Looks like you have been through quite a bit, yourself.  I hope that you are feeling good/healthy.
Posts.Title: Day 4 of waiting for Biopsy Results on Birads 5 mass heathcliff4 heathcliff4

Posts.Content: Aug 22, 2013 02:18PM heathcliff4 wrote: Thanks Lily55.  I stopped googling as soon as I heard about the Birads 5 mass (which was missed on the mammogram and I mentioned to the surgeon at our pre-op meeting for the calcifications).  I just want to know.  As, I'm sure you can relate.
